definition: end of the road/final road/fig. dead end/impasse
tip/end/final stage/latter part/inessential detail/powder/dust/opera role of old man
road/CL:條|条[tiao2]/journey/route/line (bus etc)/sort/kind
surname Lu
lit. the path exhausted, the end of the road (idiom); an impasse/in a plight with no way out/things have reached a dead end

sentences.english: That financial risks diehard of many private enterprises is the main cause toward their dooms.
sentences.chinese: 財務隱患的積重難返是很多民營企業走向末路的主因。

sentences.english: The sailor who had lost everything by shipwreck said that he was thrown on his beam-ends .
sentences.chinese: 這位在海難中失去一切的水手說，他已經窮途末路了。

sentences.english: Manufacturing, once America’s greatest strength, seemed to be in terminal decline.
sentences.chinese: 曾經是美國最爲強實力的製造業到了走到末路的衰敗。

sentences.english: Manouchehr Takin, do you agree that the nuclear renaissance is at an end?
sentences.chinese: 你認爲核工業復興會窮途末路嗎？

sentences.english: For once, they did not worry about deadlines and editors.
sentences.chinese: 他們初次可以不消爲截稿日期和編纂而懊末路。

sentences.english: When qin day also, thanks to the end by shen Qiang pulled.
sentences.chinese: 這時秦天也末路了，幸而被沈薔拉住了。

sentences.english: She actually for this unintentional mistakes and annoying.
sentences.chinese: 她竟爲這種無意之中所犯地錯而末路火。

sentences.english: It was the beginning of the end for Iron Mike.
sentences.chinese: 鐵拳邁克的末路也由此開始。

sentences.english: This does not mean that ambition is at an end.
sentences.chinese: 這並不意味着雄心已到了窮途末路。
